clinical_study.brief_title: Autonomic Reflexes During Intra-arterial Chemotherapy for Retinoblastoma
clinical_study.official_title: Cardiorespiratory Autonomic Reflexes During Superselective Ophthalmic Artery Chemotherapy for Retinoblastoma in Children: a Prospective Observational Study.

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective observational study in patients undergoing intra-arterial ophthalmic artery chemotherapy for the treatment of retinoblastoma. The main objective of the study is to evaluate the incidence of cardiorespiratory autonomic reflexes in these patients and to investigate the association between autonomic reflexes and perioperative clinical characteristics.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from the admission of the patient in the operating room until the end of the procedure (intra-arterial chemotherapy)
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the incidence of cardiorespiratory autonomic reflexes during intra-arterial chemotherapy of the ophthalmic artery in a child cancer center.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical background and autonomic reflexes occurence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the admission of the patient in the operating room until the end of the procedure.
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the association between perioperative characteristics (both baseline and intraoperative characteristics) and the incidence of cardiorespiratory autonomic reflexes

study_pop.textblock: Children undergoing cancer treatment for unilateral or bilateral retinoblastoma at the Instituto de Oncologia Pediátrica da Universidade Federal de São Paulo - GRAACC, São Paulo - Brasil.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients diagnosed with retinoblastoma and submitted to intra-arterial chemotherapy during the study period
- Informed consent form signed and dated by legal guardian and investigator
- Informed assent form signed by the patient if appropriate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of the patient or guardian to participate in the research project
